N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 606.2 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) Chapter 941 of
the Laws of 1984 permits State agencies to file with the Secretary of State
codes, rules and regulations that were previously incorporated by reference in
the agency's codes, rules and regulations, but not filed with the Secretary of

State. (b) Prior to the amendment
of section
102
of the

Executive Law by chapter 941, there was a requirement that the Secretary of

State must publish every code, rule and regulation in the

Official

Compilation of Codes, Rules and Regulations of the State of New York
(NYCRR). (c) As amended, section
102
of the

Executive Law now exempts certain codes, rules or regulations from publication
in the NYCRR, if the code, rule or regulation has been otherwise published by
the Federal government or by a private publisher. (d) Chapter 941 requires that exempt
publications must be made available for public use and inspection at the New

York State Department of State. Hence, because it will be the duty of the

Secretary of State to maintain a master compilation of all codes, rules and
regulations including those Federal and private publications that will not be
printed in NYCRR and because it will be the duty of the Secretary of State to
maintain historical files containing the official text of such documents, it is
necessary that all referenced codes, rules and regulations be prepared and
submitted for filing in a manner that will ensure that the text of each
document is identifiable and available to the public. (e) It is understood that many of the
referenced documents in question have to do with codes, rules and regulations
that have been adopted to protect the public health, safety and
welfare. (f) Since the
enforceability of those codes, rules or regulations may depend on evidence that
the material was available and is actually filed with the Secretary of State, it is essential that the text of such documents be identifiable and retrievable
from the files of the Department of State. (g) To ensure the provisions of chapter 941
of the Laws of 1984 are met, the Department of State has set forth rules in 19
NYCRR
261.2. (h) This Part, established pursuant to section 2 of chapter 941 of the Laws of 1984, and in
accordance with section
261.2
of 19 NYCRR
261
sets forth a
comprehensive listing of incorporation by reference codes, rules and
regulations, and all other referenced published data, criteria, standards, specifications, techniques, illustrations or information which are contained in
this Title and are applicable to facilities certified and/or operated by the
OPWDD. Notes
